comments.author: jirasd-gear-compute-vmi-notifier-ca-montreal-1
comments.body:
_This is comment added by a Jira Automation Workflow (NOT a human being)_

Rules of Engagement for Compute HPC/GPU Support

**Rule 1: Create an incident and choose the right component**
Please create an incident(not service request) for any support request and ensure that you select the appropriate component for accurate assistance.

**Rule 2: No Compute support for GitHub stacks**
We do not provide support for issues related to the GitHub test stacks. Tickets related to those will be closed without further action.
GitHub test stacks repository: [https://github.com/oracle-quickstart/oci-hpc/tree/master/playbooks](https://github.com/oracle-quickstart/oci-hpc/tree/master/playbooks). Reach out to the Solutions Architects in #oci-hpc-int

**Rule 3: Support for Compute HPC Images only**
We offer support exclusively for Compute HPC Images. Please refer to the following link to access the supported Compute HPC Images: [Compute HPC Images](https://objectstorage.eu-frankfurt-1.oraclecloud.com/p/_601lOOXFu5ordAFijwzLPduQ_3To16jFrej0JmxEdz1iKkr2BzqBudhqQ9uikLg/n/hpc/b/exported-compute-hpc-images/o/)

**Rule 4: Provide OCIDs for every issue**
When reporting an issue, please provide the relevant OCIDs (Instance OCIDs, Cluster Network OCIDs) associated with the problem. This information will help us investigate and resolve the issue more effectively.

**Rule 5: Include SOSReports and NVIDIA debug logs for GPU issues**
For GPU-related issues, please include the SOSReports logs and NVIDIA debug logs. These logs are valuable for troubleshooting. Please follow the instructions below to obtain them:
- To collect SOSReports logs, run the command `sudo sosreport`.
- To collect NVIDIA debug logs, execute the command `sudo nvidia-bug-report.sh`.

**Rule 6: Stay positive! We are committed to solving all your problems**
We are here to provide comprehensive support and solve all the challenges you encounter. Stay positive, and we will assist you every step of the way.

    PCIe Slot 3    STATION: 1 ACTIVE: yes, TRAINING: done, Gen5x16, SLOT: 0, TYPE: Downstream Port of PCI Express Switch
                              BUSES: 9E (9F<->A2), CAP: Gen5x16, DIDVID: C0301000, SUB_DIDVID: 00721000
    OAM8           STATION: 2 ACTIVE: yes, TRAINING: done, Gen5x16, SLOT: 0, TYPE: Downstream Port of PCI Express Switch
                              BUSES: A4 (A5<->A7), CAP: Gen5x16, DIDVID: C0301000, SUB_DIDVID: 00721000

                              BUSES: A9 (AD<->AD), CAP: Gen5x4, DIDVID: C0301000, SUB_DIDVID: 00721000

comments.author: Imane Barakate
comments.body: Raised RHS-79480 to RHS and pending their input

comments.author: Mihai Valcu
comments.body:
[~imane.barakate@oracle.com]

Please open a new CHS case and ask them to :

stop HN & TN
recheck the HN to TN CDFP cables physically ( do not run the cable flow as it might not show the correct result )
The CDFP cables from SYS/CRB1/PCIE1  &  /SYS/CRB2/PCIE2 might be reversed.
They should be like below

!Screenshot 2026-02-10 at 17.25.43.png|width=571,height=156!

Once the cabling issue is fixed or if CHS says the cables are connected as shown above, start /SYS and recheck the OAM mapping ( either with amd-smi or just run healtcheck again ).
If the issue still persists, please reload the live image (probably terminate and relaunch the instance on this host).
